Description: Automating the form and adding ScreenShot and ScreenRecording

Scenarios.Scenario: User successfully completes the multi-step form

Steps.Description: user opens the multiStepForm
user fills in the 'First name' field
user fills in the 'Last name' field
user fills in the 'E-mail' field
user clicks the 'Next' button
user fills in the 'Phone' field
user fills in the 'dd' field for birth date
user fills in the 'mm' field for birth month
user fills in the 'yyyy' field for birth year
user clicks the 'Next' button
user fills in the 'Username' field
user fills in the 'Password' field
user clicks the 'Submit' button
the form should be successfully submitted
a confirmation message should be displayed

Scenarios.Scenario: User navigates through the form steps

Steps.Description: user opens the multiStepForm
user clicks the 'Next' button on the first step
the second step of the form should be displayed
user clicks the 'Next' button on the second step
the third step of the form should be displayed
user clicks the 'Previous' button on the third step
the second step of the form should be displayed

Scenarios.Scenario: User attempts to submit the form with missing information

Steps.Description: user opens the multiStepForm
user leaves the 'First name' field empty
user clicks the 'Next' button
an error message should be displayed
the form should not proceed to the next step
user opens the multiStepForm
user enters an invalid email format in the 'E-mail' field
user clicks the 'Next' button
an error message should be displayed
the form should not proceed to the next step
user opens the multiStepForm
user is on the second step of the form
user enters an invalid date format in the 'dd', 'mm', or 'yyyy' fields
user clicks the 'Next' button
an error message should be displayed
the form should not proceed to the next step
user opens the multiStepForm
user has filled in some information
user clicks the 'Cancel' button
the form should be reset
user should be returned to the first step
